Daniels' new attorney, Michael Avenatti, has been a fixture on TV. Daniels herself is scheduled to be interviewed on 60 Minutes on March 25. But another woman, former Playboy Playmate Karen McDougal, whose story has attracted significantly less attention, may end up being a bigger problem for Trump. (McDougal will appear on TV this Thursday on CNN with Anderson Cooper.) In some respects, McDougal's story is similar to Daniels'. Like Daniels, she met Trump at a 2006 golf tournament in Lake Tahoe. Trump later wined and dined both women at the Beverly Hills Hotel.

context_meta.title: Bones found under home could crack decades-old cold case
context_meta.summary: Sandy Blampied knew something was seriously wrong when she returned to an empty Long Island home that day in October 1966 — instead of her mother's open arms. “I went to school, to seventh grade, and when I came home from school, she was gone. She never came back,” Blampied, now 63, told The Post on Tuesday. “I went to school in the morning. I gave her a hug and a kiss and I said, 'I'll see you later.' She would never leave me alone.” For more than 50 years, the disappearance of 38-year-old Louise Pietrewicz has been an unsolved mystery in Suffolk County, where she vanished without a trace other than a pocketbook found days later on the side of Route 25. Although Jennifer wasn't happy with having to explain the meaning of the word to Emily, it did help her teach her daughter a valuable lesson. context_meta.title: Japan's lonely seniors are the tip of a global epidemic of senior loneliness
context_meta.summary: Almost 1 in 5 women in Japanese prisons is a senior. Their crimes are usually minor—9 in 10 senior women who've been convicted were found guilty of shoplifting. The number of Japanese seniors living alone increased by 600 percent between 1985 and 2015 to almost 6 million. Half of the seniors caught shoplifting reported living alone, the government discovered last year, and 40 percent of them said they either don't have family or rarely speak to them. Over ten thousand of almost 6 million seniors living alone prefer prison to living alone outside. There are over 8 million lonely seniors in the United States. “They may have a house.
